Gay couple told to stop kissing on Airline Flight
 
 http://www.newyorker.com/talk/content/articles/060925ta_talk_collins
 
 I have to admit, based on this story, I don't see what the big deal is here, as far as what these gay couples were doing. People still have to have reasonable personal freedoms, regardless of the moral question. IOW, even with disapproval of someone's actions from a moral standpoint, people should be free to do what they want to do as long as it doesn't cross lines of decency, and it doesn't appear that this did in terms of the actions. Frankly, the story reminds me a but of a scene from the Adam Sadler movie "Anger Management" where everyone is blowing sandler's actions on a airplane out of proportion.

First, an anti-gay person lies. No shocker there...
 
 Then, the airline starts to cover its own XXX. And cover its own XXX. And cover its own XXX.
 
 I personally hope they get put through the ringer on this.
 I think they handled the whole "lying stewardess" XXXX well, but then their intimidation tactics afterwards are unbelievable. Threatening over and over again to "divert the plane" if they don't censor their words???
 
 I think I would have told them, "I've got a airline flight full of witnesses here, plenty of whom I am confident are happy to repeat an accurate portrayal of events. You divert this plane, and a camera crew will be waiting at the airport to get everybody's story. Questions will be asked. YOU will be making this a news event.
 I have done nothing untoward. I haven't asked for anything out of the ordinary. I have not been disruptive. I will be more than happy to not discuss this issue while I am on this airplane.
 Don't try to intimidate me on this."
 
 
 And as for the representative's statement, give me a fricken break!
 Have you EVER heard of ANY couple being asked to stop kissing in the air?
